alerts.description: Total deposits ($35,000) exceed declared monthly income ($2,500) by 1400%.

network_connections.details: Device DEV-IPHONE-99 used by both accounts within 10 minutes.
Device DEV-IPHONE-99 used by both accounts on same day.
Phone number +1-555-0199 previously registered to CUST-9922.

prior_cases.resolution_notes: Customer provided valid secondary ID verification after initial flag. Document quality issues resolved - lighting conditions caused unusual shadows on biometric scan. No fraud detected.

explainability.primary_hypothesis: Money Laundering - suspicious fund movements to obscure origin

justification.claim: Significant deposit activity is inconsistent with the customer's declared income.
business_facts: Total deposits in the last 30 days ($35,000) are 14 times higher than the declared monthly income ($2,500).

justification.claim: Transactions involve high-risk channels and counterparties, suggesting an attempt to obscure fund origins and destinations.
business_facts: A deposit of $15,000 was made via cryptocurrency from an external wallet.
A withdrawal of $14,500 was made via bank transfer to an offshore bank.
A deposit of $8,500 was received from an unknown sender.

justification.claim: Login activity shows suspicious patterns, including the use of a VPN and a new device from a high-risk location.
business_facts: A login occurred from Nigeria (Lagos) using a VPN, shortly after a login from the customer's usual location in the USA (Springfield).
This login from Nigeria used a new, untrusted mobile device (DEV-IPHONE-99) which has also been linked to other accounts.

justification.claim: The customer's identity verification documents show potential signs of manipulation.
business_facts: The customer's passport has flags for 'ai_generated_face_risk' and 'unusual_font_spacing'.

explainability.plain_english_summary: This case is critical due to strong indicators of money laundering. The customer's recent deposits ($35,000) vastly exceed their declared income ($2,500), and transactions involve high-risk channels like cryptocurrency and offshore banks. Suspicious login activity from a VPN in Nigeria on a new device, combined with potential issues on identity documents, further elevates the risk.

dashboard_summary.headline: Money Laundering - suspicious fund movements to obscure origin
key_evidence: Total deposits in the last 30 days ($35,000) are 14 times higher than the declared monthly income ($2,500).
A deposit of $15,000 was made via cryptocurrency from an external wallet.
A withdrawal of $14,500 was made via bank transfer to an offshore bank.
A login occurred from Nigeria (Lagos) using a VPN, shortly after a login from the customer's usual location in the USA (Springfield).
This login from Nigeria used a new, untrusted mobile device (DEV-IPHONE-99) which has also been linked to other accounts.
